RegionLength.name: Descriptor region length
RegionLength.help_text: If non-zero, specifies the length of the Descriptor region.

NumComponents.name: Number of Flash Components
NumComponents.help_text: Specifies the number of Flash components that will be installed on the target machine. Valid values are 0,1,2 - 0 causes only ME region to be built.

ComponentBaseAddr.name: Component Base Address
ComponentBaseAddr.help_text: Identifies address bits [11:4] for the Component portion of the Flash Descriptor.

RegionBaseAddr.name: Region base address
RegionBaseAddr.help_text: Flash Region Base Address (FRBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the Region portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0.

NumMasters.name: Number of Masters
NumMasters.help_text: Number Of Masters (NM). This field identifies the total number of Flash Regions. This number is 0's based.

MasterBaseAddr.name: Master base address
MasterBaseAddr.help_text: Identifies address bits [11:4] for the Master portion of the Flash Descriptor.

PchStrapLength.name: Number of PCH straps
PchStrapLength.help_text: PCH Strap Length (PSL). Identifies the 1s based number of Dwords of PCH Straps to be read, up to 255 DWs (1KB) max. A setting of all 0's indicates there are no PCH DW straps.

PchBaseAddr.name: PCH straps base address
PchBaseAddr.help_text: Flash PCH Strap Base Address (FPSBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the PCH Strap portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0. For validation purposes, the recommended FISBA is 0x10.

ProcStrapLength.name: Number of PROC straps
ProcStrapLength.help_text: The number of PROC straps to be read. Valid values are 0 to 1.

ProcBaseAddr.name: PROC straps base address
ProcBaseAddr.help_text: Flash Master Base Address (FMBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the Master portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0. A recommended FMBA is 20h.

ReadStatusFreq.name: Read ID and Read Status clock frequency
ReadStatusFreq.help_text: If more that one Flash component exists, this field must be the lowest common frequency of the different components.

WriteEraseFreq.name: Write and erase clock frequency
WriteEraseFreq.help_text: If more that one Flash component exists, this field must be the lowest common frequency of the different components.

FastReadFreq.name: Fast read clock frequency
FastReadFreq.help_text: This field is undefined if the Fast Read Support is set to false.

DensityComp1.name: Flash component 1 density
DensityComp1.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 1st Flash component.

DensityComp2.name: Flash component 2 density
DensityComp2.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 2nd Flash component.

DualOutputFastReadSupport.name: Dual Output Fast Read Support
DualOutputFastReadSupport.help_text: false: Not Supported. true: Dual Output Fast Read instruction is issued in all cases where the the Fast Read would have been issued.

InvalidInst0.name: Invalid Instruction 0
InvalidInst0.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst1.name: Invalid Instruction 1
InvalidInst1.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst2.name: Invalid Instruction 2
InvalidInst2.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst3.name: Invalid Instruction 3
InvalidInst3.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

FlashPartitionBndry.name: Flash Partition Boundary
FlashPartitionBndry.help_text: The FPBA build settings are configurable in Build -> Build Settings.

LowerFlashEraseSize.name: Lower Flash Erase Size
LowerFlashEraseSize.help_text: For Asymmetric flash parts, this is the lower of the two erase sizes.

UpperFlashEraseSize.name: Upper Flash Erase Size
UpperFlashEraseSize.help_text: For Asymmetric flash parts, this is the upper of the two erase sizes.

ReadAccess.name: Read Access
ReadAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0B = Production, 0x1B = Production w/ access to PDR (should ONLY be used if PDR region is implemented). Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr1[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write Access
WriteAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0A = Production, 0x1A = Production w/ access to PDR (should ONLY be used if PDR region is implemented). Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr1[31:24]

ReadAccess.name: Read Access
ReadAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0D = Production. Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr2[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write Access
WriteAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x0C = Production. Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr2[31:24]

ReadAccess.name: Read Access
ReadAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x08 = Production. Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr3[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write Access
WriteAccess.help_text: 0xFF = Debug/Manufacturing, 0x08 = Production. Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr3[31:24]

DmiReqIdDisable.name: DMI RequesterID Check Disable
DmiReqIdDisable.help_text: The purpose is to support server environments with multiple processors where each have a different RequesterID that can each access the flash. false = DMI RequesterID Checks are enabled. true = DMI RequesterID Checks are disabled.

MacSecDisable.name: MACsec Disable
MacSecDisable.help_text: MACsec is a hop-by-hop network security solution. It provides Layer 2 encryption and authenticity/integrity protection for packets traveling between MACsec-enabled nodes of the network.

LanPhyPcGp12Sel.name: LANPHYPC_GP12_SEL
LanPhyPcGp12Sel.help_text: 0 = GPIO12 default is General Purpose (GP) output. 1 = GPIO12 is used in native mode as LANPHYPC.

SmLink0Freq.name: SMLink0 Frequency
SmLink0Freq.help_text: The value of these bits determine the physical bus speed supported by the HW.

SmBusFreq.name: Intel (R) ME SMBus Frequency
SmBusFreq.help_text: The value of these bits determine the physical bus speed supported by the HW.

SmLink1Freq.name: SMLink1 Frequency
SmLink1Freq.help_text: Sets the physical bus speed supported by the HW.

SmBusAsdAddrEn.name: Intel (R) ME SMBus ASD Address Enable (MESMASDEN)
SmBusAsdAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

SmBusMctpAddrEn.name: Intel (R) ME SMBus MCTP Address Enable
SmBusMctpAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

SmBusMctpAddr.name: Intel (R) ME SMBus MCTP Address
SmBusMctpAddr.help_text: This address is used by Intel (R) ME Anti-Theft Technology FW.

SmBusI2cAddrEn.name: SMBus I2C Address Enable (SMBI2CEN)
SmBusI2cAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

PhyConnectivity.value_list: 00: No PHY connected,,10: PHY on SMLink0
PhyConnectivity.name: PHY Connectivity
PhyConnectivity.help_text: Defines if PHY is connected to Intel (R) SMBus 2 segment or not.

GbeSmBusAddr.name: GbE MAC SMBus Address
GbeSmBusAddr.help_text: This is the SMBus address used by SMT to accept SMBus cycles from the PHY.

GbePhySmBusAddr.name: GbE PHY SMBus Address
GbePhySmBusAddr.help_text: If bit 0 set, OEM programmed SmBus address is assigned to GbE PHY by chipset. This strap must be made available to ME & PMC.

Smt1SubVidDid4ASF.name: Intel (R) ME SMBus Subsystem Vendor & Device ID for ASF2
Smt1SubVidDid4ASF.help_text: [15:0]-Subsystem Vendor ID, [31:16]-Subsystem Device ID. The values are provided as bytes 8-9 and 10-11 of the data payload to an external master when it initiates a Directed GET UDID Block Read Command to the Intel (R) ME SMBus1 controller's ASF2 address.

PCIePortConf1.value_list: 00: 4x1 Ports 1-4 (x1),,01: 1x2, 2x1 Port 1 (x2), Port 2 (disabled), Ports 3, 4 (x1),,10: 2x2 Port 1 (x2), Port 3 (x2), Ports 2, 4 (disabled),,11: 1x4 Port 1 (x4), Ports 2-4 (disabled)
PCIePortConf1.name: PCIe Port Configuration 1
PCIePortConf1.help_text: These straps set the default value of PCIe Port Configuration 1 register covering PCIe ports 1-4.

PCIePortConf2.value_list: 00: 4x1 Ports 5-8 (x1),,01: 1x2, 2x1 Port 5 (x2), Port 6 (disabled), Ports 7, 8 (x1),,10: 2x2 Port 5 (x2), Port 7 (x2), Ports 6, 8 (disabled),,11: 1x4 Port 5 (x4), Ports 6-8 (disabled)
PCIePortConf2.name: PCIe Port Configuration 2
PCIePortConf2.help_text: These straps set the default value of the PCI Express Port Configuration 2 register covering ports 5-8.

PCIeLaneReversal1.name: PCIe Lane Reversal 1
PCIeLaneReversal1.help_text: This bit lane reversal behavior for PCIe* Port 1 if configured as a x4 PCIe port. false = PCIe Lanes 0-3 are not reversed. true = PCIe Lanes 0-3 are reversed when Port 1 is configured as a 1x4.

PCIeLaneReversal2.name: PCIe Lane Reversal 2
PCIeLaneReversal2.help_text: This bit lane reversal behavior for PCIe Port 5 if configured as a x4 PCIe* port. false = PCIe Lanes 4-7 are not reversed. true = PCIe Lanes 4-7 are reversed when Port 5 is configured as a 1x4.

DmiLaneReversal.name: DMI Lane Reversal
DmiLaneReversal.help_text: false: DMI lanes 0-3 are not reversed. true: DMI lanes 0-3 are reversed.

GbePciePortSelect.name: Intel (R) PHY PCIe Port Select (PHY_PCIEPORTSEL)
GbePciePortSelect.help_text: Sets the default value of the PRC.GBEPCIERPSEL register which is used to determine which PCIe port to use for GBE MAC/PHY over PCI Express communication.

GbeOverPcieEn.name: Intel (R) PHY Over PCI Express Enable (PHY_PCIE_EN)
GbeOverPcieEn.help_text: false: GbE MAC/PHY comm. is not enabled over PCIe. true: The port selected by GBE PCIe Port Select is used for GbE MAC/PHY over PCIe comm.

SubtractDecodeAgentEn.name: Subtractive Decode Agent Enable
SubtractDecodeAgentEn.help_text: Set this bit to 'true' if there is a PCI bridge chip connnected to the PCH, that requires subtractive decode agent. Set to 'false' if the platform has no PCI bridge chip.

PchHotSml1AlertSel.name: PCHHOT# or SML1ALERT# Select
PchHotSml1AlertSel.help_text: This strap determines the native mode operation of GPIO74

Reserved.name: Reserved
Reserved.help_text: Intel Reserved. This is an unsupported setting and must be set to false.

MeDbgSmbusEmergencyModeAddr.name: ME Debug SMBus Emergency Mode Address
MeDbgSmbusEmergencyModeAddr.help_text: SMBUS address used for ME Debug status writes.

MeDbgSmbusEmergencyModeEn.name: ME Debug SMBus Emergency Mode Enable
MeDbgSmbusEmergencyModeEn.help_text: This should be set to 'true' if it is desired to capture events with the ME Debug tool. This bit should be set to 'false' for production platforms.

IccBootProfile.name: ICC Boot Profile
IccBootProfile.help_text: If ICC Boot Profile is selected by soft strap then this parameter specifies the profile number.

MeResetCapture.name: ME Reset Capture on CL_RST1#
MeResetCapture.help_text: true = ME will assert at the CL_RST1# when it resets. false = ME does not assert.

IccProfileSelBy.name: ICC Boot Profile Selected By Soft Strap
IccProfileSelBy.help_text: Determines if ICC Boot Profile is specified by BIOS (via Intel (R) MEI) or by soft strap. true = Soft Strap. false = BIOS (via Intel (R) MEI).

DeepSx.name: Deep SX Enable
DeepSx.help_text: Deep SX refers to two low power states that are referred to Deep S4 and Deep S5.

MeDbgLanEmergencyModeEn.name: ME Debug LAN Emergency Mode
MeDbgLanEmergencyModeEn.help_text: This bit should be set to 'true' if it is desired to capture events with the ME Debug tool. This bit should be set to 'false' for production platforms.

SmLink1GpAddrEn.name: SMLink1 GP Target Address Enable
SmLink1GpAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

SmLink1I2cAddrEn.name: SMLink1 I2C Target Address Enable
SmLink1I2cAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Reserved0.name: Reserved0
Reserved0.help_text: Intel Reserved. This is an unsupported setting and must be set to false.

IntLanEn.name: Intel (R) Integrated LAN Enable
IntLanEn.help_text: false = internal MAC is power down. true = internal MAC is powered. This should be set to true if the platform is intending to use Intel (R) Integrated LAN Solution

SlpLanGpio29Sel.name: SLP_LAN#/GPIO29 Select
SlpLanGpio29Sel.help_text: false = GPIO29 can only used only as SLP_LAN# for Intel integrated LAN solution. true = GPIO29 is available for GPIO configuration

SmLink1ThermRepSel.name: SMLink1 Thermal Reporting Select
SmLink1ThermRepSel.help_text: false = Intel ME FW will collect temperature from the processor, PCH and DIMMs. true = PCH temperature (1 byte of data) will be available for polling out on SMLink1.

IcBtSoftStrp.value_list: Full Clock Integrated Mode,,Buffered Through Mode
IcBtSoftStrp.name: BTM/FCIM Select
IcBtSoftStrp.help_text: If PCH clock boot mode is specified by this soft strap, then this parameter specifies whether PCH clocks boot in FCIM or BTM.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

VendorId.name: Vendor ID
VendorId.help_text: The vendor specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId0.name: Device ID 0
DeviceId0.help_text: The first device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

DeviceId1.name: Device ID 1
DeviceId1.help_text: The second device specific byte of the JEDEC ID.

InputFile.name: OEM Section Binary input file
InputFile.help_text: The contents of this file (up to 256 bytes) are copied directly into the OEM section of the Flash Descriptor.

RegionLength.name: BIOS region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the BIOS region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

InputFile.name: BIOS binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the BIOS image binary that will be copied into this region.

RegionLength.name: GbE LAN region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the GbE LAN region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

InputFile.name: GbE binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the Gbe image binary that will be copied into this region.

LANEn.name: Intel (R) Integrated LAN Enable
LANEn.help_text: Intel (R) Integrated LAN related PCH Straps are set up automatically according to this setting.

RegionLength.name: PDR region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the PDR region in bytes. Set this to zero and specify an input file if you want the tool to determine the appropriate size for the region.

InputFile.name: PDR binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the PDR image binary that will be copied into this region.

InputFile.name: ME Binary Input File
InputFile.help_text: This is the path to a binary file that will be used for the ME region.

PermitFile.name: PCH MTP Permit File
PermitFile.help_text: Adds the PCH MTP permit data to the ME region.

CpuMtpPermitFile.name: CPU MTP Permit File
CpuMtpPermitFile.help_text: Adds the CPU MTP permit data to the ME region.

RegionOffset.name: Region Offset
RegionOffset.help_text: The offset from the beginning of flash where the ME region will start. If 0, then FITC will determine where to put it based on the region order.

RomBypassVector.name: Rom Bypass Vector Instruction
RomBypassVector.help_text: Up to 128 bits, this field represents the instruction that is placed at the beginning of the FPT used to jump to the Rom Bypass partition.

RegionLength.name: ME region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the ME region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

FlashCycleLifetime.name: Flash Cycle Lifetime
FlashCycleLifetime.help_text: Time in years the flash should last.

FlashCycleLimit.name: Flash Cycle Limit
FlashCycleLimit.help_text: This number multiplied by 1000 equals the maximum number of erase cycles the flash can perform.

TicksToAdd.name: Ticks to add
TicksToAdd.help_text: This is used for access management.

TokensToAdd.name: Tokens to add
TokensToAdd.help_text: This is used for access management.

FptHeaderVer.name: FPT Header Version
FptHeaderVer.help_text: Defines the FPT header type set in the FPT header.

FptEntryType.name: FPT Entry Type
FptEntryType.help_text: Defines the FPT entry type set in the FPT header that defines the type of entries used in the FPT.

MeLayoutType.name: ME Layout Type
MeLayoutType.help_text: This setting reflects the layout type used after modifying the build settings.

FwuOemId.name: FW Update OEM ID
FwuOemId.help_text: Enter UUID or file containing the UUID. This UUID will make sure that customers can only update a platform with an image coming from the OEM of the platform. If set to zero than any input is valid (including none) when doing a FW update.

LanPowerWell.name: LAN Power Well Config
LanPowerWell.help_text: 0 = Core Well, 1 = Sus Well, 2 = ME Well, 3 = SLP_LAN# (MGPIO3)

WlanPowerWell.name: WLAN Power Well Config
WlanPowerWell.help_text: 0x80 = Disabled, 0x82 = Sus Well, 0x83 = ME Well, 0x85 = WLAN Power Controlled via SLP_M# || SLP_ME_CSW_DEV#

HostMeRegUnlock.name: Host ME Region Flash Protection Override
HostMeRegUnlock.help_text: Set this to TRUE if you want the ability to have BIOS write to the ME Region. Set to FALSE to opt out.

SubSysVendId.name: Sub System Vendor ID
SubSysVendId.help_text: This ID allows OEMs the ability to test boards using Manufacturing Test Permits.

ProcMissing.value_list: No onboard glue logic,,Glue logic tied to GPIO24
ProcMissing.name: PROC_MISSING
ProcMissing.help_text: This value will determine if there is glue logic present on the platform to detect a missing processor on desktop platforms.

ProcEmulation.value_list: No Emulation,,EMULATE Intel (R) vPro (TM) capable Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Core (TM) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Celeron (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Pentium (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Xeon (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Xeon (R) Manageability capable Processor
ProcEmulation.name: Processor Emulation
ProcEmulation.help_text: This gives the option to emulate different Intel ME FW behavior by changing the processor type on pre-production silicon. This field has no effect on production silicon.

OemTag.name: OEM Tag
OemTag.help_text: An OEM identification number to describe the flash image represented by the value.

HideFwUpdCtrl.name: Hide FW Update Control
HideFwUpdCtrl.help_text: Setting this parameter to 'true' will not allow end users to 'disable' or 'password protect' the ME FW Update mechanism

DbgSiFeat.name: Debug Si Features
DbgSiFeat.help_text: Allows OEM control to enable FW features to assist with debug of the platform. This control has no effect if used on production silicon.

ProdSiFeat.name: Prod Si Features
ProdSiFeat.help_text: Allows OEM control to enable FW features to assist with production of the platform.

AutoBist.name: M3 Autotest Enabled
AutoBist.help_text: This enables ME M3 auto test during platform early boot.

IfrEnabled.name: Independent Firmware Recovery Enable
IfrEnabled.help_text: This allows firmware to be updated via locally installed agent software.

PrivacySecurityLevel.name: Privacy/Security Level
PrivacySecurityLevel.help_text: Configures ME redirection ports. Default - enables Client Control mode, enables all ports and RCFG, Enhanced - enables Client Control mode, RCFG and requires user consent for redirection, Extreme - disables Client Control mode, RCFG and disables redirection

MeIdleTimeout.name: Idle Timeout - Manageability Engine
MeIdleTimeout.help_text: Set ME Remote Wake on LAN time out. Valid values are 1-65535.

Package2.name: Power Pkg 2 Supported (Mobile: ON in S0, ME Wake in S3, S4-5 (AC only))
Package2.help_text: Power Package available or not. true = Available. false = Not available.

DefPwrPkg.name: Default Power Package
DefPwrPkg.help_text: Select the default Power Package from the available packages.

MngFullPerm.name: Enable Intel (R) Standard Manageability; Disable Intel (R) AMT

ManageAppPerm.name: Manageability Application Permanently Disabled?
ManageAppPerm.help_text: Setting this to Yes permanently disables all manageability application features.

PavPerm.name: PAVP Permanently Disabled?
PavPerm.help_text: Select whether Protected Audio Video Path (PAVP) is permanently disabled.

KvmPerm.name: KVM Permanently Disabled?
KvmPerm.help_text: Select whether KVM is permanently disabled.

TlsPerm.name: TLS Permanently Disabled?
TlsPerm.help_text: Select whether TLS is permanently disabled.

ATPerm.name: Intel (R) Anti-Theft Technology Permanently Disabled?
ATPerm.help_text: Select whether Intel (R) Anti-Theft Technology is permanently disabled.

MeNetworkService.name: Intel (R) ME Network Service Permanently Disabled?
MeNetworkService.help_text: Select whether Intel (R) ME Network Service is permanently disabled.

ServiceAdvDiscovery.name: Service Advertisement and Discovery Permanently Disabled?
ServiceAdvDiscovery.help_text: Select whether Service Advertisement and Discovery is permanently disabled.

ManageAppShipState.name: Manageability Application Enable/Disable
ManageAppShipState.help_text: Select whether or not Manageability Application is enabled or disabled.

UpgrdSrvcOdmId.name: ODM ID used by Intel (R) Services
UpgrdSrvcOdmId.help_text: ID generated by or registered with Intel (R) Services web servers in order to identify the ODM/Board builder. First of three IDs stored in flash and accessible through Intel (R) MEI interface.

UpgrdSrvcSysIntId.name: System Integrator ID used by Intel (R) Services
UpgrdSrvcSysIntId.help_text: ID generated by or registered with Intel (R) Services web servers in order to identify the System Integrator. Second of three IDs stored in flash and accessible through Intel (R) MEI interface.

UpgrdSrvcRsvdId.name: Reserved ID used by Intel (R) Services
UpgrdSrvcRsvdId.help_text: Reserved ID may be used for a Reseller ID or other Intel (R) Services IDs in the future.

MctpStaticEids.name: MCTP Static EIDs
MctpStaticEids.help_text: Defines the ME's 8-bits MCTP Endpoint IDs for each SMBus physical interface (SMBus, SMLink0 and SMLink1). These values are needed for FW to communicate with MCTP end points.

MctpInfo3G.name: MCTP Info 3G
MctpInfo3G.help_text: Defines the 7-bits MCTP address of the 3G NIC card on ME SMBus. This value is needed if there is a 3G NIC card working with Intel AT.

PlatformDescriptorRecord.name: Platform Descriptor Record
PlatformDescriptorRecord.help_text: Defines the file whose content is to be used for Platform Descriptor Record.

PermitTimerResolution.name: Permit Period Timer Resolution
PermitTimerResolution.help_text: This setting determines what the permit period timer resolution will be.

PkiDnsSuffix.name: PKI DNS Suffix
PkiDnsSuffix.help_text: Set PKI DNS Suffix in dotted string format.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Default Certificate Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Default Certificate Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Customizable Certificate 1 Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Customizable Certificate 1 Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Customizable Certificate 2 Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Customizable Certificate 2 Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Customizable Certificate 3 Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Customizable Certificate 3 Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Default Certificate 2 Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Default Certificate 2 Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Default Certificate 3 Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Default Certificate 3 Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Default Certificate 4 Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Default Certificate 4 Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

FriendlyName.name: OEM Default Certificate 4 Friendly Name
FriendlyName.help_text: Enter Hash Name. Maximum of 32 characters.

Stream.name: OEM Default Certificate 4 Stream
Stream.help_text: Enter raw hash string or certificate file.

EhbcEnabled.name: Embedded Host Based Configuration
EhbcEnabled.help_text: Embedded Host Based Configuration Enabled. If this is set to true, then Privacy/Security Level will be read-only and set to Default. If Privacy/Security Level is set to non-Default, then this setting will be read-only and set to false.

AllowUnsignedAssertStolen.name: Allow Unsigned Assert Stolen
AllowUnsignedAssertStolen.help_text: true = Unsigned Assert Stolen is enabled. false = The Unsigned Assert Stolen is disabled.

ATBiosRcvryTimer.name: Intel (R) Anti-Theft BIOS Recovery Timer
ATBiosRcvryTimer.help_text: This timer will enable a stolen platform a 30 minute window to allow a FW/BIOS reflash before the system is powered down.

ATFpopHard.value_list: Always Allowed,,Allowed When AT Not Provisioned
ATFpopHard.name: Flash Protection Override Policy Hard
ATFpopHard.help_text: Indicates under which AT conditions it is allowed for ME to enter disabled state to allow full SPI device re-flashing when the HMRFPO is set.

ATFpopSoft.value_list: Always Allowed,,Allowed When AT Not Provisioned
ATFpopSoft.name: Flash Protection Override Policy Soft
ATFpopSoft.help_text: Indicates under which AT conditions it is allowed for ME to enter disabled state via BIOS based MEI messages and allow ME only region re-flash.

PRAM.name: Logging Interface - PRAM
PRAM.help_text: true = Enabled false = Disabled. If enabled no other logging interface can be enabled

BufferSize.name: Buffer Size
BufferSize.help_text: Set the buffer size. If Buffer Mode is set to Blocking this must be set to 0

MacAddr.name: Destination MAC Address
MacAddr.help_text: Enter a MAC Address for the destination

SupportedProfiles.name: Total Number of ICC Profiles
SupportedProfiles.help_text: A single image can support up to 8 clock configuration profiles (OEM Request Records). Use ICC OEM Config Select in PCH Strap 10 to indicate which one of 8 images the built SPI flash binary will boot from.

CSS.name: Clock Source Select
CSS.help_text: This parameter controls clock source selection for non-PCI Express* clocks.

SSS.name: SRC Source Select
SSS.help_text: This parameter controls clock source selection for PCI Express* clocks.

PLLRCS.name: PLL Reference Clock Select
PLLRCS.help_text: This parameter controls clock source selection for PCI Express* clocks.

IBEN.name: Input Buffer Enable
IBEN.help_text: This parameter controls enabling of input buffers.

DIVEN.name: Divider Enable
DIVEN.help_text: This parameter controls enabling of divider blocks.

SSCCTL.name: SSC Control
SSCCTL.help_text: This parameter controls spread spectrum modulation capability of SSC blocks.

FCSS.name: Flex Clock Source Select
FCSS.help_text: This parameter controls muxing to select sources for Flex Clock outputs.

OBEN.name: OBEN
OBEN.help_text: This parameter has been deprecated. All functionality previously specified for this parameter is now available in OCKEN parameter.

OCKEN.name: Output Clock Enable
OCKEN.help_text: This parameter controls enabling of output buffers.

OCKENMaskBeforePost.name: Output Clock Allow Enable/Disable Before POST
OCKENMaskBeforePost.help_text: Output Clock Allow Enable/Disable Before POST

OCKENMaskAfterPost.name: Output Clock Allow Enable/Disable After POST
OCKENMaskAfterPost.help_text: Output Clock Allow Enable/Disable After POST

PM1.name: PM1 - Power Management
PM1.help_text: This parameter controls power management features of clocks.

PM2.name: PM2 - Power Management
PM2.help_text: This parameter controls power management features of clocks.

SEBP1.name: SEBP1
SEBP1.help_text: This parameter controls double/single load series resistance and slew rate for FLEX clocks.

SEBP2.name: SEBP2
SEBP2.help_text: This parameter controls double/single load series resistance and slew rate for PCI clocks. PCI Specifications 2.4 and 3.0 allow for an acceptable slew rate range of 1 - 4 V/ns. ME FW programmability allows for slew rate to be specified between 0.6 - 2 V/ns for two reasons: 1. Slew rates exceeding 2 V/ns can have adverse effects on platform EMI 2. Slew rates lower than 1 V/ns can be specified for EMI benefits, at the risk of violating PCI specification

PMSRCCLK1.name: PMSRCCLK1
PMSRCCLK1.help_text: This parameter as signs dynamic CLKRQ# control of SRC clocks.

PMSRCCLK2.name: PMSRCCLK2
PMSRCCLK2.help_text: This parameter assigns dynamic CLKRQ# control of SRC clocks.

ClkDivMin.name: Clock Div Min
ClkDivMin.help_text: Minimum allowed clock divisor value (minimum value is for maximum frequency).

ClkDivMax.name: Clock Div Max
ClkDivMax.help_text: Maximum allowed clock divider value (maximum value is for minimum frequency).

SscChngAllwd.name: SSC Change Allowed Mask
SscChngAllwd.help_text: true = SSC parameters of this clock resource can be controlled by the handled request record. false = default parameters are used.

SscSprPercentMax.name: SSC Spread Percent Max
SscSprPercentMax.help_text: The caller of the interface can set SSC spread percent from 0 (SSC disabled) to this value. The value should be SSC percent multiplied by 100. Range supported is 0 to 250d (2.5%)

ClockUsage.name: Clock Usage
ClockUsage.help_text: The overclocking BIOS and OS applications can know which clock is used as BCLK and is subject for CPU overclocking, which is used for integrated GFX display and is subject for underclocking.

ClkDivMin.name: Clock Div Min
ClkDivMin.help_text: Minimum allowed clock divisor value (minimum value is for maximum frequency).

ClkDivMax.name: Clock Div Max
ClkDivMax.help_text: Maximum allowed clock divider value (maximum value is for minimum frequency).

SscChngAllwd.name: SSC Change Allowed Mask
SscChngAllwd.help_text: true = SSC parameters of this clock resource can be controlled by the handled request record. false = default parameters are used.

SscSprPercentMax.help_text: The caller of the interface can set SSC spread percent from 0 (SSC disabled) to this value. The value should be SSC percent multiplied by 100. Range supported is 0 to 250d (2.5%)
